010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
028
029import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
030
031/**
032 * <p>
033 * This class defines a set of static methods for calculations with vectors and
034 * matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing object structures.
035 * Matrices are simple two-dimensional arrays {@code A[r][c]}, where {@code r}
036 * is the (vertical) <strong>row</strong> index and {@code c} is the
037 * (horizontal) <strong>column</strong> index (as common in linear algebra).
038 * This means that matrices are really vectors of row vectors. Only arrays of
039 * type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported. All matrices are assumed
040 * to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).
041 * </p>
042 * <p>
043 * Note: Methods named with a trailing '{@code D}' (e.g.,
044 * {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) operate destructively, i.e., modify one
045 * of the supplied arguments.
046 * </p>
047 * 
048 * @author WB
049 * @version 2022/08/29
050 */
051@SuppressWarnings("serial")
052public abstract class Matrix {
053        
054        private Matrix() {}
055        
056        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers by {@code toString()} methods. */
057        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
058        
059        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
060        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
061        
062        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
063        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
064        
065        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
066        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
067        
068        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
069        
070        /**
071         * <p>Creates and returns a {@code double[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
072         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
073         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
074         * </p>
075         * <pre>
076         * double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(2, 3, 
077         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
078         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
079         * <p>
080         * See also {@link #flatten(double[][])}.
081         * </p>
082         * 
083         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
084         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
085         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
086         * @return a {@code double[][]} matrix
087         */
088        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
089                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
090                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
091                        return A;
092                }
093                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
094                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
095                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
096                }
097                
098                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
099                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
100                                A[r][c] = values[i];
101                                i++;
102                        }
103                }               
104                return A;
105        }
106        
107        /**
108         * <p>
109         * Creates and returns a {@code float[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
110         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
111         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
112         * </p>
113         * <pre>
114         * float[][] A = makeFloatMatrix(2, 3, 
115         *              1.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f,
116         *              4.0f, 5.0f, 6.0f );</pre>
117         * <p>
118         * See also {@link #flatten(float[][])}.
119         * </p>
120         * 
121         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
122         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
123         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code float[]})
124         * @return a {@code float[][]} matrix
125         */
126        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
127                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
128                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
129                        return A;
130                }
131                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
132                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
133                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
134                }       
135                
136                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
137                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
138                                A[r][c] = values[i];
139                                i++;
140                        }
141                }               
142                return A;
143        }
144        
145        /**
146         * <p>
147         * Creates and returns a {@link RealMatrix} containing the specified {@code double} values.
148         * Calls {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
149         * </p>
150         * <pre>
151         * RealMatrix A = makeRealMatrix(2, 3, 
152         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
153         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
154         * <p>
155         * See also {@link #flatten(RealMatrix)}.
156         * </p>
157         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
158         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
159         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
160         * @return a {@link RealMatrix} 
161         */
162        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
163                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
164        }
165        
166
167        /**
168         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
169         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
170         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
171         * See also {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
172         *  
173         * @param A a matrix
174         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
175         */
176        public static double[] flatten(double[][] A) {
177                final int rows = A.length;
178                final int cols = A[0].length;
179                final double[] vals = new double[rows * cols];
180                int i = 0;
181                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
182                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
183                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
184                                i++;
185                        }
186                }
187                return vals;
188        }
189        
190        /**
191         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code float[]}
192         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
193         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
194         * See also {@link #makeFloatMatrix(int, int, float...)}.
195         *  
196         * @param A a matrix
197         * @return a {@code float[]} with the matrix elements
198         */
199        public static float[] flatten(float[][] A) {
200                final int rows = A.length;
201                final int cols = A[0].length;
202                final float[] vals = new float[rows * cols];
203                int i = 0;
204                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
205                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
206                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
207                                i++;
208                        }
209                }
210                return vals;
211        }
212        
213        /**
214         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
215         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
216         * See also {@link #makeRealMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
217         *  
218         * @param A a matrix
219         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
220         */
221        public static double[] flatten(RealMatrix A) {
222                return flatten(A.getData());
223        }
224        
225        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
226        
227        /**
228         * Creates and returns a {@code double[]} vector from the
229         * specified values.
230         * 
231         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
232         * @return a {@code double[]}
233         */
234        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
235                return values;
236        }
237        
238        /**
239         * Creates and returns a {@code float[]} vector from the
240         * specified values.
241         * 
242         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code float[]})
243         * @return a {@code float[]}
244         */
245        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
246                return values;
247        }
248        
249        /**
250         * Creates and returns a {@link RealVector} from the
251         * specified {@code double} values.
252         * 
253         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
254         * @return a {@link RealVector} 
255         */
256        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
257                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
258//              return new ArrayRealVector(values);
259        }
260        
261        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
262        
263        /**
264         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double[]} vector of the 
265         * specified length.
266         * Throws an exception if the length is less than 1.
267         * @param length the length of the vector
268         * @return a {@code double[]} with zero values
269         */
270        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
271                if (length < 1)
272                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
273                return new double[length];
274        }
275        
276        /**
277         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
278         * specified size.
279         * Throws an exception if the size is less than 1.
280         * @param size the size of the matrix
281         * @return an identity matrix
282         */
283        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
284                if (size < 1)
285                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
286                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
287                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
288                        A[i][i] = 1;
289                }
290                return A;
291        }
292        
293        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
294
295        /**
296         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code double} matrix.
297         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
298         * @return the number of rows
299         */
300        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
301                return A.length;
302        }
303        
304        
305        /**
306         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code double} matrix.
307         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
308         * @return the number of columns
309         */
310        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
311                return A[0].length;
312        }
313        
314        /**
315         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code float} matrix.
316         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
317         * @return the number of rows
318         */
319        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
320                return A.length;
321        }
322        
323        /**
324         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code float} matrix.
325         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
326         * @return the number of columns
327         */
328        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
329                return A[0].length;
330        }
331        
332        /**
333         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
334         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
335         * @return the number of rows
336         */
337        public static int getNumberOfRows(RealMatrix A) {
338                return A.getRowDimension();
339        }
340        
341        /**
342         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
343         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
344         * @return the number of columns
345         */
346        public static int getNumberOfColumns(RealMatrix A) {
347                return A.getColumnDimension();
348        }
349        
350        // Extract rows or columns
351        
352        /**
353         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code double} matrix 
354         * as a {@code double} vector.
355         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
356         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
357         * @return a {@code double} vector
358         */
359        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
360                return A[r].clone();
361        }
362        
363        /**
364         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code float} matrix 
365         * as a {@code float} vector.
366         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
367         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
368         * @return a {@code float} vector
369         */
370        public static float[] getRow(float[][] A, int r) {
371                return A[r].clone();
372        }
373        
374        /**
375         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code double} matrix 
376         * as a {@code double} vector.
377         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
378         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
379         * @return a {@code double} vector
380         */
381        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
382                final int rows = A.length;
383                double[] col = new double[rows];
384                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
385                        col[r] = A[r][c];
386                }
387                return col;
388        }
389        
390        /**
391         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code float} matrix 
392         * as a {@code float} vector.
393         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
394         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
395         * @return a {@code float} vector
396         */
397        public static float[] getColumn(float[][] A, int c) {
398                final int rows = A.length;
399                float[] col = new float[rows];
400                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
401                        col[r] = A[r][c];
402                }
403                return col;
404        }
405        
406        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
407        
408        /**
409         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
410         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
411         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
412         */
413        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
414                final int nCols = A[0].length;
415                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
416                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
417                                return false;
418                        }
419                }
420                return true;
421        }
422        
423        /**
424         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
425         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
426         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
427         */
428        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
429                final int nCols = A[0].length;
430                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
431                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
432                                return false;
433                        }
434                }
435                return true;
436        }
437        
438        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
439         * and columns.
440         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
441         * @return true iff the matrix is square
442         */
443        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
444                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
445        }
446        
447        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
448         * and columns.
449         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
450         * @return true iff the matrix is square
451         */
452        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
453                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
454        }
455        
456        /**
457         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
458         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
459         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
460         */
461        public static double[] getDiagonal(double[][] A) {
462                if (!isSquare(A)) {
463                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
464                }
465                final int n = A.length;
466                double[] diag = new double[n];
467                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
468                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
469                }
470                return diag;
471        }
472        
473        /**
474         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
475         * @param A a square {@code float[][]} matrix
476         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
477         */
478        public static float[] getDiagonal(float[][] A) {
479                if (!isSquare(A)) {
480                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
481                }
482                final int n = A.length;
483                float[] diag = new float[n];
484                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
485                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
486                }
487                return diag;
488        }
489        
490        /**
491         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
492         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
493         * @return the {@link RealVector} of diagonal elements
494         */
495        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
496                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(getDiagonal(A.getData()));
497        }
498        
499        /**
500         * Creates and returns a diagonal matrix from the specified 
501         * vector. See also {@link #getDiagonal(double[][])}.
502         * 
503         * @param d vector of diagonal matrix elements
504         * @return a diagonal matrix
505         */
506        public double[][] diagMatrix(double[] d) {
507                return MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d).getData();
508        }
509        
510        /**
511         * Checks is the given square {@code double[][]} matrix is non-singular.
512         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
513         * @return true if the matrix is singular
514         */
515        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
516                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
517                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
518                }       
519                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));
520        }
521        
522        /**
523         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
524         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
525         * @return true if the matrix is singular
526         */
527        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
528                if (!A.isSquare()) {
529                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
530                }               
531                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
532                return !solver.isNonSingular();
533        }
534        
535        /** Default matrix symmetry tolerance. */
536        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
537        
538        /**
539         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
540         * using the specified relative tolerance.
541         * @param A a square matrix
542         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
543         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
544         */
545        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
546                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
547        }
548        
549        /**
550         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
551         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
552         * @param A a square matrix
553         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
554         */
555        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
556                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
557        }
558        
559        /**
560         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
561         * using the specified relative tolerance.
562         * @param A a square matrix
563         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
564         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
565         */
566        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
567                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
568        }
569        
570        /**
571         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
572         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
573         * @param A a square matrix
574         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
575         */
576        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
577                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
578        }
579        
580        /**
581         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite,
582         * using the specified symmetry tolerance value.
583         * 
584         * @param A a square matrix
585         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
586         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
587         */
588        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) { //TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
589                try {
590                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
591                        return true;
592                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
593                return false;
594        }
595        
596        /**
597         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
598         * @param A a square matrix
599         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
600         */
601        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
602                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
603        }
604        
605        /**
606         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
607         * @param a first vector
608         * @param b second vector
609         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
610         */
611        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
612                return a.length == b.length;
613        }
614        
615        /**
616         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
617         * @param a first vector
618         * @param b second vector
619         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
620         */
621        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
622                return a.length == b.length;
623        }
624        
625        /**
626         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
627         * @param A first matrix
628         * @param B second matrix
629         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
630         */
631        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
632                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
633        }
634        
635        /**
636         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
637         * @param A first matrix
638         * @param B second matrix
639         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
640         */
641        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
642                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
643        }
644
645        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
646
647        /**
648         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[]} vector. 
649         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
650         * @return a copy of the vector
651         */
652        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] a) {
653                return a.clone();
654        }
655        
656        /**
657         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[]} vector. 
658         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
659         * @return a copy of the vector
660         */
661        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] a) {
662                return a.clone();
663        }
664
665        /**
666         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[][]} matrix. 
667         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
668         * @return a copy of the matrix
669         */
670        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
671                final int m = A.length;
672                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
673                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
674                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
675                }
676                return B;
677        }
678        
679        /**
680         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[][]} matrix. 
681         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
682         * @return a copy of the matrix
683         */
684        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
685                final int m = A.length;
686                float[][] B = new float[m][];
687                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
688                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
689                }
690                return B;
691        }
692        
693        // vector copying ------------------------------
694        
695        /**
696         * Copy data from one {@code float[]} vector to another.
697         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
698         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
699         * @param target the target vector (modified)
700         */
701        public static void copyD(float[] source, float[] target) {
702                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
703        }
704        
705        /**
706         * Copy data from one {@code double[]} vector to another.
707         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
708         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
709         * @param target the target vector (modified)
710         */
711        public static void copyD(double[] source, double[] target) {
712                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
713        }
714        
715        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
716        
717        /**
718         * Converts a {@code double[]} to a {@code float[]}.
719         * @param a the original {@code double[]} array
720         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[]}
721         */
722        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] a) {
723                final int m = a.length;
724                final float[] b = new float[m];
725                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
726                        b[i] = (float) a[i];
727                }
728                return b;
729        }
730        
731        /**
732         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code float[][]}.
733         * @param A the original {@code double[][]} array
734         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
735         */
736        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
737                final int m = A.length;
738                final int n = A[0].length;
739                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
740                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
741                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
742                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
743                        }
744                }
745                return B;
746        }
747        
748        /**
749         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code long[][]} whose elements contain
750         * the 64-bit representation of the original {@code double} values. Its printed
751         * representation is comparatively compact (see {@link #toString(long[][])}).
752         * This is useful for defining literal {@code double} arrays without losing any
753         * precision (by avoiding conversion to decimal representation). Note that the
754         * {@code long} are bit representations and cannot be used to perform any
755         * arithmetic calculations.
756         * 
757         * @param A the original {@code double} array
758         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
759         * @see #fromLongBits(long[][])
760         * @see #toString(long[][])
761         * @see #printToStream(long[][], PrintStream)
762         */
763        public static long[][] toLongBits(final double[][] A) {
764                final int m = A.length;
765                final int n = A[0].length;
766                final long[][] B = new long[m][n];
767                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
768                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
769                                B[i][j] = Double.doubleToLongBits(A[i][j]);
770                        }
771                }
772                return B;
773        }
774        
775        /**
776         * Converts a {@code long[][]} with 64-bit {@code double} representations to the
777         * equivalent {@code double[][]}. This is useful for defining literal
778         * {@code double} arrays without losing any precision (by avoiding conversion to
779         * decimal representation).
780         * 
781         * @param A a {@code long} array
782         * @return the equivalent {@code double} array
783         * @see #toLongBits(double[][])
784         */
785        public static double[][] fromLongBits(final long[][] A) {
786                final int m = A.length;
787                final int n = A[0].length;
788                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
789                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
790                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
791                                B[i][j] = Double.longBitsToDouble(A[i][j]);
792                        }
793                }
794                return B;
795        }
796        
797        /**
798         * Converts a {@code float[]} to a {@code double[]}.
799         * @param a the original {@code float[]} array
800         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[]}
801         */
802        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] a) {
803                final int m = a.length;
804                final double[] B = new double[m];
805                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
806                        B[i] = a[i];
807                }
808                return B;
809        }
810        
811        /**
812         * Converts a {@code float[][]} to a {@code double[][]}.
813         * @param A the original {@code float[][]} array
814         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[][]}
815         */
816        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
817                final int m = A.length;
818                final int n = A[0].length;
819                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
820                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
821                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
822                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
823                        }
824                }
825                return B;
826        }
827        
828        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
829        
830        /**
831         * Fills the given {@code double} vector with the specified value (destructively).
832         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
833         * @param val the fill value
834         */
835        public static void fillD(final double[] x, double val) {
836                Arrays.fill(x, val);
837        }
838        
839        /**
840         * Fills the given {@code float} vector with the specified value (destructively).
841         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
842         * @param val the fill value
843         */
844        public static void fillD(final float[] x, float val) {
845                Arrays.fill(x, val);
846        }
847        
848        /**
849         * Fills the given {@code double} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
850         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
851         * @param val the fill value
852         */
853        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
854                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
855                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
856                }
857        }
858        
859        /**
860         * Fills the given {@code float} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
861         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
862         * @param val the fill value
863         */
864        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
865                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
866                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
867                }
868        }
869        
870
871        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
872        
873        /**
874         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} vectors
875         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
876         * different lengths.
877         * None of the arguments is modified.
878         * @param a the first vector
879         * @param b the second vector
880         * @return a new {@code double} vector
881         */
882        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
883                double[] c = b.clone();
884                addD(a, c);
885                return c;
886        }
887        
888        /**
889         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} vector
890         * to the second vector (destructively).
891         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
892         * different lengths.
893         * The second vector is modified.
894         * @param a the first vector
895         * @param b the second vector
896         */
897        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
898                if (!sameSize(a, b))
899                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
900                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
901                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
902                }
903        }
904        
905        /**
906         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} vectors
907         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
908         * different lengths.
909         * None of the arguments is modified.
910         * @param a the first vector
911         * @param b the second vector
912         * @return a new {@code float} vector
913         */
914        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
915                float[] c = b.clone();
916                addD(a, c);
917                return c;
918        }
919        
920        /**
921         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} vector
922         * to the second vector (destructively).
923         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of different lengths.
924         * The second vector is modified.
925         * @param a the first vector
926         * @param b the second vector
927         */
928        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
929                if (!sameSize(a, b))
930                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
931                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
932                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
933                }
934        }
935
936        /**
937         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} matrix
938         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
939         * different size.
940         * None of the arguments is modified.
941         * @param A the first matrix
942         * @param B the second matrix
943         * @return a new {@code double} matrix
944         */
945        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
946                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
947                addD(A, C);
948                return C;
949        }
950        
951        /**
952         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} matrix
953         * to the second vector (destructively).
954         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
955         * different size.
956         * The second matrix is modified.
957         * @param A the first matrix
958         * @param B the second matrix
959         */
960        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
961                if (!sameSize(A, B))
962                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
963                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
964                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
965                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
966                        }
967                }
968        }
969        
970        /**
971         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} matrix
972         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
973         * different size.
974         * None of the arguments is modified.
975         * @param A the first matrix
976         * @param B the second matrix
977         * @return a new {@code float} matrix
978         */
979        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
980                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
981                addD(A, C);
982                return C;
983        }
984        
985        /**
986         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} matrix
987         * to the second vector (destructively).
988         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
989         * different size.
990         * The second matrix is modified.
991         * @param A the first matrix
992         * @param B the second matrix
993         */
994        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
995                if (!sameSize(A, B))
996                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
997                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
998                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
999                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
1000                        }
1001                }
1002        }
1003        
1004        // ------------------------------------------------
1005        
1006        /**
1007         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code double} vectors
1008         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
1009         * different lengths.
1010         * None of the arguments is modified.
1011         * @param a the first vector
1012         * @param b the second vector
1013         * @return a new {@code double} vector
1014         */
1015        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1016                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1017                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1018                final int n = a.length;
1019                double[] c = new double[n];
1020                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1021                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
1022                }
1023                return c;
1024        }
1025        
1026        // non-destructive a - b
1027        /**
1028         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code float} vectors
1029         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
1030         * different lengths.
1031         * None of the arguments is modified.
1032         * @param a the first vector
1033         * @param b the second vector
1034         * @return a new {@code float} vector
1035         */
1036        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
1037                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1038                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1039                final int n = a.length;
1040                float[] c = new float[n];
1041                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1042                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
1043                }
1044                return c;
1045        }
1046
1047        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
1048
1049        // non-destructive
1050        /**
1051         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1052         * {@code double[]} vector (non-destructive).
1053         * @param s a scalar
1054         * @param x a vector
1055         * @return a new vector
1056         */
1057        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] x) {
1058                double[] b = x.clone();
1059                multiplyD(s, b);
1060                return b;
1061        }
1062        
1063        // destructive
1064        /**
1065         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar.
1066         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1067         * @param s a scalar
1068         * @param x a vector
1069         */
1070        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] x) {
1071                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1072                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1073                }
1074        }
1075        
1076        // non-destructive
1077        /**
1078         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1079         * {@code double[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1080         * @param s a scalar
1081         * @param A a matrix
1082         * @return a new matrix
1083         */
1084        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1085                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
1086                multiplyD(s, B);
1087                return B;
1088        }
1089        
1090        /**
1091         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1092         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1093         * @param s a scalar
1094         * @param A a matrix
1095         */
1096        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1097                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1098                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1099                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1100                        }
1101                }
1102        }
1103        
1104        // non-destructive
1105        /**
1106         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1107         * {@code float[]} vector (non-destructive).
1108         * @param s a scalar
1109         * @param x a vector
1110         * @return a new vector
1111         */
1112        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] x) {
1113                float[] B = duplicate(x);
1114                multiplyD(s, B);
1115                return B;
1116        }
1117        
1118        // destructive
1119        /**
1120         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar.
1121         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1122         * @param s a scalar
1123         * @param x a matrix
1124         */
1125        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] x) {
1126                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1127                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1128                }
1129        }
1130
1131        // non-destructive
1132        /**
1133         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1134         * {@code float[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1135         * @param s a scalar
1136         * @param A a matrix
1137         * @return a new matrix
1138         */
1139        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1140                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
1141                multiplyD(s, B);
1142                return B;
1143        }
1144        
1145        // destructive
1146        /**
1147         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1148         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1149         * @param s a scalar
1150         * @param A a matrix
1151         */
1152        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1153                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1154                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1155                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1156                        }
1157                }
1158        }
1159        
1160        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
1161
1162        /**
1163         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A "from the left", i.e., y = x * A,
1164         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
1165         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1166         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1167         * @return a (row) vector of length n
1168         */
1169        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
1170                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1171                multiplyD(x, A, y);
1172                return y;
1173        }
1174        
1175        /**
1176         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
1177         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1178         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1179         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
1180         */
1181        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) {
1182                if (x == y) 
1183                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1184                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1185                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1186                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
1187                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1188                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1189                        double s = 0;
1190                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
1191                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
1192                        }
1193                        y[i] = s;
1194                }
1195        }
1196
1197        /**
1198         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1199         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1200         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1201         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1202         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1203         */
1204        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
1205                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1206                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1207                return y;
1208        }
1209        
1210        /**
1211         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1212         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1213         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1214         * which is modified.
1215         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
1216         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1217         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1218         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1219         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1220         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1221         */
1222        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) {
1223                if (x == y) 
1224                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1225                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1226                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1227                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1228                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1229                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1230                        double s = 0;
1231                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1232                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1233                        }
1234                        y[i] = s;
1235                }
1236        }
1237        
1238        /**
1239         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
1240         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1241         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1242         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1243         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1244         */
1245        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
1246                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1247                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1248                return y;
1249        }
1250        
1251        /**
1252         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1253         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1254         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1255         * which is modified.
1256         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
1257         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1258         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1259         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1260         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1261         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1262         */
1263        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) {
1264                if (x == y) 
1265                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1266                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1267                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1268                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1269                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1270                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1271                        double s = 0;
1272                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1273                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1274                        }
1275                        y[i] = (float) s;
1276                }
1277        }
1278        
1279
1280        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
1281        
1282        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1283        /**
1284         * Returns the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1285         * as a new {@code double[][]} matrix.
1286         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1287         * @param A first matrix
1288         * @param B second matrix
1289         * @return the matrix product A * B
1290         */
1291        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
1292                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1293                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1294                if (nA != mB)
1295                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1296                int ma = getNumberOfRows(A);
1297                int nb = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1298                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(ma, nb);
1299                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1300                return C;
1301        }
1302        
1303        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1304        /**
1305         * Calculates the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1306         * and places the results in the third {@code double[][]} matrix C,
1307         * which is modified (destructively).
1308         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1309         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1310         * @param A first matrix
1311         * @param B second matrix
1312         * @param C the result matrix
1313         */
1314        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) 
1315                        throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1316                if (A == C || B == C) 
1317                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1318                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1319                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1320                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1321                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1322                if (nA != mB)
1323                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1324                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1325                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1326                
1327                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1328                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1329                                double s = 0;
1330                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1331                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1332                                }
1333                                C[i][j] = s;
1334                        }
1335                }
1336        }
1337        
1338        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1339        /**
1340         * Returns the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1341         * as a new {@code float[][]} matrix.
1342         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1343         * @param A first matrix
1344         * @param B second matrix
1345         * @return the matrix product A * B
1346         */
1347        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
1348                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1349                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1350                if (nA != mB)
1351                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1352                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1353                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1354                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
1355                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1356                return C;
1357        }
1358
1359        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1360        /**
1361         * Calculates the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1362         * and places the results in the third {@code float[][]} matrix C,
1363         * which is modified (destructively).
1364         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1365         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1366         * @param A first matrix
1367         * @param B second matrix
1368         * @param C the result matrix
1369         */
1370        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) {
1371                if (A == C || B == C) 
1372                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1373                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1374                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1375                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1376                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1377                if (nA != mB)
1378                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A,B
1379                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1380                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1381                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1382                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1383                                float s = 0;
1384                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1385                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1386                                }
1387                                C[i][j] = s;
1388                        }
1389                }
1390        }
1391        
1392        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
1393        
1394        /**
1395         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
1396         * which must have the same length.
1397         * Throws an exceptions if vector dimensions do not match.
1398         * @param a first vector
1399         * @param b second vector
1400         * @return the dot product
1401         */
1402        public static double dotProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1403                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1404                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1405                double sum = 0;
1406                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1407                        sum = sum + a[i] * b[i];
1408                }
1409                return sum;
1410        }
1411        
1412        // a is considered a column vector, b is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
1413        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
1414        /**
1415         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
1416         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
1417         * m is the length of the second vector.
1418         * @param a first (column) vector (of length m)
1419         * @param b second (row) vector (of length n)
1420         * @return the outer product (matrix)
1421         */
1422        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1423                final int m = a.length;
1424                final int n = b.length;
1425                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
1426                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1427                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1428                                M[i][j] = a[i] * b[j];
1429                        }
1430                }
1431                return M;
1432        }
1433
1434        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
1435
1436        /**
1437         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1438         * @param a a vector
1439         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1440         */
1441        public static double normL1(final double[] a) {
1442                double sum = 0;
1443                for (double val : a) {
1444                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1445                }
1446                return sum;
1447        }
1448        
1449        /**
1450         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1451         * @param a a vector
1452         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1453         */
1454        public static float normL1(final float[] a) {
1455                double sum = 0;
1456                for (double val : a) {
1457                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1458                }
1459                return (float) sum;
1460        }
1461
1462        /**
1463         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1464         * @param a a vector
1465         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1466         */
1467        public static double normL2(final double[] a) {
1468                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(a));
1469        }
1470
1471        /**
1472         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1473         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1474         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1475         * @param a a vector
1476         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1477         */
1478        public static double normL2squared(final double[] a) {
1479                double sum = 0;
1480                for (double val : a) {
1481                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1482                }
1483                return sum;
1484        }
1485
1486        /**
1487         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1488         * @param x a vector
1489         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1490         */
1491        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
1492                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1493        }
1494
1495        /**
1496         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1497         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1498         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1499         * @param a a vector
1500         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1501         */
1502        public static double normL2squared(final float[] a) {
1503                double sum = 0;
1504                for (double val : a) {
1505                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1506                }
1507                return sum;
1508        }
1509        
1510        // Normalize vectors
1511        
1512        /**
1513         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1514         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code double[]} vector.
1515         * @param a a vector
1516         * @return the normalized vector
1517         */
1518        public static double[] normalize(final double[] a) {
1519                double[] xx = duplicate(a);
1520                normalizeD(xx);
1521                return xx;
1522        }
1523        
1524        /**
1525         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1526         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1527         * @param a a vector
1528         */
1529        public static void normalizeD(final double[] a) {
1530                double normx = normL2(a);
1531                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1532                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector " + Matrix.toString(a));
1533                multiplyD(1.0 / normx, a);
1534        }
1535        
1536        /**
1537         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1538         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code float[]} vector.
1539         * @param a a vector
1540         * @return the normalized vector
1541         */
1542        public static float[] normalize(final float[] a) {
1543                float[] xx = duplicate(a);
1544                normalizeD(xx);
1545                return xx;
1546        }
1547        
1548        /**
1549         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1550         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1551         * @param a a vector
1552         */
1553        public static void normalizeD(final float[] a) {
1554                double normx = normL2(a);
1555                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1556                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1557                multiplyD((float) (1.0 / normx), a);
1558        }
1559        
1560        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
1561        
1562        /** 
1563         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1564         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1565         * number of elements.
1566         * @param a first vector
1567         * @param b second vector
1568         * @return the distance
1569         */
1570        public static double distL2(double[] a, double[] b) {
1571                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1572        }
1573        
1574        /** 
1575         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1576         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1577         * number of elements.
1578         * @param a first vector
1579         * @param b second vector
1580         * @return the squared distance
1581         */
1582        public static double distL2squared(double[] a, double[] b) {
1583                double sum = 0;
1584                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1585                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1586                }
1587                return sum;
1588        }
1589        
1590        /** 
1591         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1592         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1593         * number of elements.
1594         * @param a first vector
1595         * @param b second vector
1596         * @return the distance
1597         */
1598        public static float distL2(float[] a, float[] b) {
1599                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1600        }
1601        
1602        /** 
1603         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1604         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1605         * number of elements.
1606         * @param a first vector
1607         * @param b second vector
1608         * @return the squared distance
1609         */
1610        public static float distL2squared(float[] a, float[] b) {
1611                double sum = 0;
1612                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1613                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1614                }
1615                return (float) sum;
1616        }
1617        
1618        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
1619        
1620        /**
1621         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
1622         * @param A a matrix
1623         * @return the norm of the matrix
1624         */
1625        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
1626                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1627                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1628                double s = 0;
1629                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1630                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1631                                s = s + sqr(A[i][j]);
1632                        }
1633                }
1634                return Math.sqrt(s);
1635        }
1636
1637        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
1638
1639        /**
1640         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1641         * {@code double[]} vector.
1642         * @param a a vector
1643         * @return the sum of vector elements
1644         */
1645        public static double sum(final double[] a) {
1646                double sum = 0;
1647                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1648                        sum = sum + a[i];
1649                }
1650                return sum;
1651        }
1652        
1653        /**
1654         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1655         * {@code double[][]} matrix.
1656         * @param A a matrix
1657         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1658         */
1659        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
1660                double sum = 0;
1661                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1662                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1663                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1664                        }
1665                }
1666                return sum;
1667        }
1668        
1669        /**
1670         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1671         * {@code float[]} vector.
1672         * @param a a vector
1673         * @return the sum of vector elements
1674         */
1675        public static double sum(final float[] a) {
1676                double sum = 0;
1677                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1678                        sum = sum + a[i];
1679                }
1680                return sum;
1681        }
1682        
1683        /**
1684         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1685         * {@code float[][]} matrix.
1686         * @param A a matrix
1687         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1688         */
1689        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1690                double sum = 0;
1691                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1692                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1693                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1694                        }
1695                }
1696                return sum;
1697        }
1698        
1699        // --------------------------------------------------
1700        
1701        /**
1702         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1703         * @param A a matrix
1704         * @param row the row index
1705         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1706         */
1707        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1708                return sum(A[row]);
1709        }
1710        
1711        /**
1712         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1713         * @param A a matrix
1714         * @param row the row index
1715         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1716         */
1717        public static double sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1718                return sum(A[row]);
1719        }
1720        
1721
1722        /**
1723         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1724         * @param A a matrix
1725         * @param col the column index
1726         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1727         */
1728        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1729                double sum = 0;
1730                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1731                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1732                }
1733                return sum;
1734        }
1735        
1736        /**
1737         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1738         * @param A a matrix
1739         * @param col the column index
1740         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1741         */
1742        public static double sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1743                double sum = 0;
1744                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1745                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1746                }
1747                return sum;
1748        }
1749        
1750        /**
1751         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1752         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1753         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1754         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1755         */
1756        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1757                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1758                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1759                        double sum = 0;
1760                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1761                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1762                        }
1763                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1764                }
1765                return sumVec;
1766        }
1767        
1768        /**
1769         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1770         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1771         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1772         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1773         */
1774        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1775                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1776                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1777                        double sum = 0;
1778                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1779                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1780                        }
1781                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1782                }
1783                return sumVec;
1784        }
1785        
1786        /**
1787         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1788         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1789         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1790         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1791         */
1792        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1793                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1794                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1795                        double sum = 0;
1796                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1797                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1798                        }
1799                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1800                }
1801                return sumVec;
1802        }
1803        
1804        /**
1805         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1806         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1807         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1808         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1809         */
1810        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1811                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1812                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1813                        double sum = 0;
1814                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1815                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1816                        }
1817                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1818                }
1819                return sumVec;
1820        }
1821        
1822        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1823        
1824        /**
1825         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1826         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1827         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1828         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1829         * 
1830         * @param a a vector
1831         * @return the index of the smallest value
1832         */
1833        public static int idxMin(double[] a) {
1834                if (a.length == 0)
1835                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1836                double minval = a[0];
1837                int minidx = 0;
1838                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1839                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1840                                minval = a[i];
1841                                minidx = i;
1842                        }
1843                }
1844                return minidx;
1845        }
1846        
1847        /**
1848         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1849         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1850         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1851         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1852         * 
1853         * @param a a vector
1854         * @return the index of the smallest value
1855         */
1856        public static int idxMin(float[] a) {
1857                if (a.length == 0)
1858                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1859                float minval = a[0];
1860                int minidx = 0;
1861                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1862                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1863                                minval = a[i];
1864                                minidx = i;
1865                        }
1866                }
1867                return minidx;
1868        }
1869        
1870        
1871        /**
1872         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1873         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1874         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1875         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1876         * 
1877         * @param a a vector
1878         * @return the index of the largest value
1879         */
1880        public static int idxMax(double[] a) {
1881                if (a.length == 0)
1882                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1883                double maxval = a[0];
1884                int maxidx = 0;
1885                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1886                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1887                                maxval = a[i];
1888                                maxidx = i;
1889                        }
1890                }
1891                return maxidx;
1892        }
1893        
1894        /**
