1895         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1896         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1897         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1898         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1899         * 
1900         * @param a a vector
1901         * @return the index of the largest value
1902         */
1903        public static int idxMax(float[] a) {
1904                if (a.length == 0)
1905                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1906                float maxval = a[0];
1907                int maxidx = 0;
1908                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1909                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1910                                maxval = a[i];
1911                                maxidx = i;
1912                        }
1913                }
1914                return maxidx;
1915        }
1916        
1917        
1918        /**
1919         * Returns the smallest value in the
1920         * specified vector. 
1921         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1922         * @param a a vector
1923         * @return the largest value
1924         */
1925        public static float min(final float[] a) {
1926                if (a.length == 0)
1927                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1928                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1929                for (float val : a) {
1930                        if (val < minval) {
1931                                minval = val;
1932                        }
1933                }
1934                return minval;
1935        }
1936        
1937        /**
1938         * Returns the smallest value in the
1939         * specified vector. 
1940         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1941         * @param a a vector
1942         * @return the largest value
1943         */
1944        public static double min(final double[] a) {
1945                if (a.length == 0)
1946                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1947                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1948                for (double val : a) {
1949                        if (val < minval) {
1950                                minval = val;
1951                        }
1952                }
1953                return minval;
1954        }
1955        
1956        /**
1957         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[]} vector. 
1958         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1959         * @param a a vector
1960         * @return the largest value
1961         */
1962        public static double max(final double[] a) {
1963                if (a.length == 0)
1964                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1965                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1966                for (double val : a) {
1967                        if (val > maxval) {
1968                                maxval = val;
1969                        }
1970                }
1971                return maxval;
1972        }
1973
1974        /**
1975         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[]} vector. 
1976         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1977         * @param a a vector
1978         * @return the largest value
1979         */
1980        public static float max(final float[] a) {
1981                if (a.length == 0)
1982                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1983                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1984                for (float val : a) {
1985                        if (val > maxval) {
1986                                maxval = val;
1987                        }
1988                }
1989                return maxval;
1990        }
1991        
1992        /**
1993         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[][]} matrix. 
1994         * @param A a matrix
1995         * @return the largest matrix value
1996         */
1997        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1998                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1999                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
2000                        for (double val : A[r]) {
2001                                if (val > maxval) {
2002                                        maxval = val;
2003                                }
2004                        }
2005                }
2006                return maxval;
2007        }
2008        
2009        /**
2010         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[][]} matrix. 
2011         * @param A a matrix
2012         * @return the largest matrix value
2013         */
2014        public static float max(float[][] A) {
2015                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2016                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
2017                        for (float val : A[r]) {
2018                                if (val > maxval) {
2019                                        maxval = val;
2020                                }
2021                        }
2022                }
2023                return maxval;
2024        }
2025        
2026        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
2027        
2028        /**
2029         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2030         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2031         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2032         */
2033        public static float[] join(float[]... as) {
2034                int n = 0;
2035                for (float[] x : as) {
2036                        n = n + x.length;
2037                }
2038                float[] va = new float[n];
2039                int j = 0;
2040                for (float[] x : as) {
2041                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2042                                va[j] = x[i];
2043                                j++;
2044                        }
2045                }               
2046                return va;
2047        }
2048
2049        /**
2050         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2051         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2052         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2053         */
2054        public static double[] join(double[]... as) {
2055                int n = 0;
2056                for (double[] x : as) {
2057                        n = n + x.length;
2058                }
2059                double[] va = new double[n];    
2060                int j = 0;
2061                for (double[] x : as) {
2062                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2063                                va[j] = x[i];
2064                                j++;
2065                        }
2066                }               
2067                return va;
2068        }
2069        
2070        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
2071        
2072        /**
2073         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2074         * which must have the same length.
2075         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2076         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2077         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2078         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2079         * @return the interpolated vector
2080         */
2081        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
2082                final float[] c = new float[a.length];
2083                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2084                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2085                }
2086                return c;
2087        }
2088        
2089        /**
2090         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2091         * which must have the same length.
2092         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2093         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2094         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2095         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2096         * @return the interpolated vector
2097         */
2098        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
2099                final double[] c = new double[a.length];
2100                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2101                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2102                }
2103                return c;
2104        }
2105        
2106        
2107        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
2108        
2109        /**
2110         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
2111         * vector by attaching an additional 1-element.
2112         * The resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the 
2113         * specified Cartesian vector.
2114         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
2115         * @param ac a Cartesian vector
2116         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
2117         */
2118        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] ac) {
2119                double[] xh = new double[ac.length + 1];
2120                for (int i = 0; i < ac.length; i++) {
2121                        xh[i] = ac[i];
2122                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
2123                }
2124                return xh;
2125        }
2126        
2127        /**
2128         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
2129         * vector, which is one element shorter.
2130         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
2131         * @param ah a homogeneous vector
2132         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
2133         */
2134        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] ah) throws DivideByZeroException {
2135                double[] xc = new double[ah.length - 1];
2136                final double s = 1 / ah[ah.length - 1];
2137                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
2138                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
2139                for (int i = 0; i < ah.length - 1; i++) {
2140                        xc[i] = s * ah[i];
2141                }
2142                return xc;
2143        }
2144        
2145        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
2146        
2147        /**
2148         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@link RealMatrix}.
2149         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2150         * @param A a square matrix
2151         * @return the determinant
2152         */
2153        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) {
2154                if (!A.isSquare())
2155                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2156                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
2157        }
2158        
2159        /**
2160         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2161         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2162         * @param A a square matrix
2163         * @return the determinant
2164         */
2165        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) {
2166                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
2167        }
2168        
2169        /**
2170         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2171         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2172         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2173         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2174         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2175         * @return the determinant
2176         */
2177        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) {
2178                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2179                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2180                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2181        }
2182        
2183        /**
2184         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2185         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2186         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2187         * @return the determinant
2188         */
2189        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) {
2190                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2191                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2192                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2193        }
2194        
2195
2196        /**
2197         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2198         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2199         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2200         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2201         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2202         * @return the determinant
2203         */
2204        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) {
2205                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2206                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2207                return 
2208                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
2209                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
2210                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
2211                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
2212                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
2213                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2214        }
2215        
2216        /**
2217         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2218         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2219         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2220         * @return the determinant
2221         */
2222        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) {
2223                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2224                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2225                return
2226                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
2227                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
2228                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
2229                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
2230                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
2231                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2232        }
2233
2234
2235        
2236        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
2237        
2238        /**
2239         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2240         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2241         * @param A a square matrix
2242         * @return the trace 
2243         */
2244        public static double trace(final double[][] A) {
2245                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2246                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2247                if (m != n) 
2248                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2249                double s = 0;
2250                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2251                                s = s + A[i][i];
2252                }
2253                return s;
2254        }
2255        
2256        /**
2257         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2258         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2259         * @param A a square matrix
2260         * @return the trace 
2261         */
2262        public static float trace(final float[][] A) {
2263                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2264                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2265                if (m != n) 
2266                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2267                double s = 0;
2268                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2269                                s = s + A[i][i];
2270                }
2271                return (float) s;
2272        }
2273        
2274        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
2275        
2276        /**
2277         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2278         * The original matrix is not modified.
2279         * @param A a matrix
2280         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2281         */
2282        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
2283                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2284                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2285                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
2286                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2287                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2288                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2289                        }
2290                }
2291                return At;
2292        }
2293        
2294        /**
2295         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2296         * The original matrix is not modified.
2297         * @param A a matrix
2298         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2299         */
2300        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
2301                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2302                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2303                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
2304                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2305                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2306                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2307                        }
2308                }
2309                return At;
2310        }

2313        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
2314        
2315        /**
2316         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2317         * using the specified tolerance value.
2318         * @param a a vector
2319         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2320         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2321         */
2322        public static boolean isZero(double[] a, double tolerance) {
2323                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2324                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2325                                return false;
2326                        }
2327                }
2328                return true;
2329        }
2330        
2331        /**
2332         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2333         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2334         * @param a a vector
2335         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2336         */
2337        public static boolean isZero(double[] a) {
2338                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2339        }
2340        
2341        /**
2342         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2343         * using the specified tolerance value.
2344         * @param a a vector
2345         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2346         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2347         */
2348        public static boolean isZero(float[] a, float tolerance) {
2349                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2350                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2351                                return false;
2352                        }
2353                }
2354                return true;
2355        }
2356        
2357        /**
2358         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2359         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2360         * @param a a vector
2361         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2362         */
2363        public static boolean isZero(float[] a) {
2364                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
2365        }
2366        
2367        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
2368        
2369        /**
2370         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2371         * using the specified tolerance value.
2372         * @param A a matrix
2373         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2374         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2375         */
2376        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
2377                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
2378                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
2379                                return false;
2380                        }
2381                }
2382                return true;
2383        }
2384        
2385        /**
2386         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2387         * using default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2388         * @param A a matrix
2389         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2390         */
2391        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
2392                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2393        }

2395        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
2396        
2397        /**
2398         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code double[]} vector.
2399         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2400         * 
2401         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
2402         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2403         */
2404        public static double[] sort(double[] a) {
2405                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2406                Arrays.sort(y);
2407                return y;
2408        }
2409        
2410        /**
2411         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code float[]} vector.
2412         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2413         * 
2414         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
2415         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2416         */
2417        public static float[] sort(float[] a) {
2418                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2419                Arrays.sort(y);
2420                return y;
2421        }
2422        
2423        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
2424        
2425        /**
2426         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2427         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
2428         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2429         * @param A a square matrix
2430         * @return the inverse matrix
2431         */
2432        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2433                if (!isSquare(A))
2434                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2435                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
2436                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
2437        }
2438        
2439        /**
2440         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2441         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
2442         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2443         * @param A a square matrix
2444         * @return the inverse matrix
2445         */
2446        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2447                if (!isSquare(A))
2448                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2449                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
2450                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
2451        }
2452
2453        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2454        
2455        /**
2456         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2457         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2458         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2459         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2460         * Calls {@link #solve(RealMatrix, RealVector)}.
2461         * 
2462         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2463         * @param b a vector of length n
2464         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2465         */
2466        
2467        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
2468                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
2469                return (x == null) ? null : x.toArray();
2470        }
2471        
2472        /**
2473         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2474         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2475         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2476         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2477         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
2478         * 
2479         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2480         * @param b a vector of length n
2481         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2482         */
2483        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
2484                if (!A.isSquare()) {
2485                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2486                }
2487                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
2488                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2489                }
2490//              DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
2491                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
2492                RealVector x = null;
2493                try {
2494                        x = solver.solve(b);
2495                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
2496                return x;
2497        }
2498        
2499        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
2500        
2501        /**
2502         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2503         * @param a a vector
2504         * @return the string representation
2505         */
2506        public static String toString(double[] a) {
2507                if (a == null) {
2508                        return String.valueOf(a);
2509                }
2510                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2511                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2512                printToStream(a, strm);
2513                return bas.toString();
2514        }
2515

2517         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2518         * @param a a vector
2519         * @return the string representation
2520         */
2521        public static String toString(float[] a) {
2522                if (a == null) {
2523                        return String.valueOf(a);
2524                }
2525                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2526                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2527                printToStream(a, strm);
2528                return bas.toString();
2529        }

2531        /**
2532         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2533         * @param a a vector
2534         * @return the string representation
2535         */
2536        public static String toString(RealVector a) {
2537                if (a == null) {
2538                        return String.valueOf(a);
2539                }
2540                else {
2541                        return toString(a.toArray());
2542                }
2543        }

2550        public static String toString(double[][] A) {

2552                        return String.valueOf(A);
2553                }
2554                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2555                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2556                printToStream(A, strm);
2557                return bas.toString();
2558        }

2567                        return String.valueOf(A);

2596        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {

2599                }
2600                else {
2601                        return toString(A.getData());
2602                }

2604        
2605        // --------------------
2606        
2607        /**
2608         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2609         * the specified output stream.
2610         * @param a the vector
2611         * @param strm the output stream
2612         * @see #toString(double[])
2613         */
2614        public static void printToStream(double[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2615                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2616                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2617                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2618                        if (i > 0)
2619                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2620                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2621                }
2622                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2623                strm.flush();
2624        }
2625        
2626        /**
2627         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2628         * the specified output stream.
2629         * @param A the matrix
2630         * @param strm the output stream
2631         * @see #toString(double[][])
2632         */
2633        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2634                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2635                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2636                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2637                        if (i == 0)
2638                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2639                        else
2640                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2641                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2642                                if (j == 0) 
2643                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2644                                else
2645                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2646                        }
2647                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2648                }
2649                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2650                strm.flush();
2651        }
2652        
2653        /**
2654         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2655         * the specified output stream.
2656         * @param a the vector
2657         * @param strm the output stream
2658         * @see #toString(float[])
2659         */
2660        public static void printToStream(float[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2661                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2662                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2663                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2664                        if (i > 0)
2665                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2666                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2667                }
2668                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2669                strm.flush();
2670        }
2671        
2672        /**
2673         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2674         * the specified output stream.
2675         * @param A the matrix
2676         * @param strm the output stream
2677         * @see #toString(float[][])
2678         */
2679        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2680                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2681                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2682                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2683                        if (i == 0)
2684                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2685                        else
2686                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2687                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
2688                                if (j == 0) 
2689                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2690                                else
2691                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2692                        }
2693                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2694                }
2695                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2696                strm.flush();
2697        }
2698        
2699        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2700        
2701        public static void printToStream(long[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2702                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2703                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2704                        if (i == 0)
2705                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2706                        else
2707                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2708                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2709                                if (j == 0) 
2710                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%dL", A[i][j]);
2711                                else
2712                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c %dL", SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2713                        }
2714                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2715                }
2716                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2717                strm.flush();
2718        }
2719
2720        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
2721        
2722        /** Thrown when the dimensions of matrix/vector arguments do not match. */
2723        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {          
2724                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
2725                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
2726                }
2727                public IncompatibleDimensionsException(String msg) {
2728                        super(msg);
2729                }
2730        }
2731        
2732        /** Thrown when a non-square matrix is encountered where a square matrix is assumed. */
2733        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
2734                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
2735                        super("square matrix expected");
2736                }
2737                public NonsquareMatrixException(String msg) {
2738                        super(msg);
2739                }
2740        }
2741        
2742        /** Thrown when source and target objects are identical but shouldn't. */
2743        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
2744                public SameSourceTargetException() {
2745                        super("source and target must not be the same");
2746                }
2747                public SameSourceTargetException(String msg) {
2748                        super(msg);
2749                }
2750        }
2751        
2752        /** Thrown when the length of some vector is zero. */
2753        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {        
2754                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
2755                        super("vector length must be at least 1");
2756                }
2757                public ZeroLengthVectorException(String msg) {
2758                        super(msg);
2759                }
2760        }
2761        
2762        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2763        
2764        public static void main(String[] args) {
2765                double s = Double.NaN;
2766                s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
2767                System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
2768                System.out.println((double[]) null);
2769                
2770                double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(5, 4,
2771                                -1,2,3,4,
2772                                5,6,7,8,
2773                                9,10,11,12,
2774                                13,14,15,16,
2775                                17,18,19, Double.NaN);
2776                System.out.println("A = \n" + toString(A));
2777                
2778//              RealMatrix B = makeRealMatrix(5, 4);
2779//              System.out.println("B = \n" + toString(B.getData()));
2780                
2781                long[][] AL = Matrix.toLongBits(A);
2782                System.out.println("AL = \n" + toString(AL));
2783                
2784                double[][] A2 = Matrix.fromLongBits(AL);
2785                System.out.println("A2 = \n" + toString(A2));
2786                
2787                double[][] A3 = Matrix.fromLongBits(new long[][]
2788                                {{-4616189618054758400L, 4611686018427387904L, 4613937818241073152L, 4616189618054758400L}, 
2789                                 {4617315517961601024L, 4618441417868443648L, 4619567317775286272L, 4620693217682128896L}, 
2790                                 {4621256167635550208L, 4621819117588971520L, 4622382067542392832L, 4622945017495814144L}, 
2791                                 {4623507967449235456L, 4624070917402656768L, 4624633867356078080L, 4625196817309499392L}, 
2792                                 {4625478292286210048L, 4625759767262920704L, 4626041242239631360L, 9221120237041090560L}});
2793                
2794                System.out.println("A3 = \n" + toString(A3));
2795                
2796        }
